description: Often replaced due to wear, trend shifts, or sports use. Commonly made from synthetic rubber, EVA foam, and plastic textiles. Difficult to recycle with components that resist breakdown for decades to centuries.

Discarded due to fit changes or fashion cycles. Usually made from cotton blends with elastane and chemically treated finishes. Recycling is energy-intensive synthetic additives hinder biodegradability.
Frequently replaced for variety or during sales. Often made of cotton-polyester blends and dyed synthetics. Difficult to separate fibers, dyes persist in the environment.

Replaced before worn out due to branding, fading, or trend turnover. Generally made from polyester or cotton-poly blends with printed graphics. Releases microplastics when washed and is rarely recycled.
Discarded due to wear or loss. Often made of polyester, nylon, and elastic fibers. Too small and blended for recycling; shed microfibers with each wash.
Discarded often brand new or barely-worn. Commonly made of polyester or cotton-polyester blends. Major contributor to microplastic pollution and persistent landfill waste.
